cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting north-northeast through the western Gulf, then expected to bend westward toward the central–upper Texas coast during the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast (roughly between Port O’Connor and Freeport, TX)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island (yellow shading on graphic)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf coast from northeastern Mexico to the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to 35-40 mph possible late Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft surge along the upper Texas coast and within Galveston Bay as the system nears the coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain bands could bring 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts, producing flash-flood concerns around Houston
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and minor coastal flooding that may hamper vessel movements and terminal operations
